name: ddc677ea-ac54-44d9-bed1-9b4b2a5bc502
displayName: How to find claims in collections

text.text: How can I find claims in collections using the Dashboard?

text: To find claims in collections using the Dashboard, you can click the arrow next to "Closed" under "Claims by status". This will show you a list of claims in collections. You can also click the number under the "Claims" column to see more details.

text.text: i cant find closed status in claim by status . what should i do?

text: If you don't see the closed status in the "Claims by status" list, you can click "Choose statuses" and then click the right arrow to move it from the "Hidden" column to the "Visible" column. You can also click "Save".

text.text: How can I find claims in collections using the Reports?

text: To find claims in collections using the Reports, you can run the "Accounts in Collections" report. This report lists accounts sent to both the collection agency and state debt collections. You can also export the information to Excel by clicking the print icon and selecting Excel.

text.text: How can I find claims in collections using the Dashboard?

text: To find claims in collections using the Dashboard, you can click the arrow next to "Closed" under "Claims by status". This will show you a list of claims in collections. You can also click the number under the "Claims" column to see more details.

text.text: What should I do if I don't see the closed status in the 'Claims by status' list on the Dashboard?

text: If you don't see the closed status in the "Claims by status" list on the Dashboard, you can run the "Accounts in Collections" report. This report lists accounts sent to both the collection agency and state debt collections. You can also export the information to Excel by clicking the print icon and selecting Excel.

text.text: How do I add the closed status to the 'Claims by status' list on the Dashboard?

text: To add the closed status to the "Claims by status" list on the Dashboard, you can click Choose statuses, then click Closed to highlight and click the right arrow to move it from the Hidden column to the Visible column. You can also click Save.

text.text: When I click the number under the 'Claims' column on the Dashboard, what will I see?

text: When you click the number under the "Claims" column on the Dashboard, you will see a list of claims.

text.text: How can I find claims in collections using Reports?

text: To find claims in collections using Reports, you can run the "Accounts in Collections" report. This report lists accounts sent to both the collection agency and state debt collections. You can also export the information to Excel by clicking the print icon and selecting Excel.

text.text: Which option should I select after hovering over Analytics on the navigation bar to access Reports?

text: To access Reports, you can hover over Analytics on the navigation bar and select Reports.

text.text: What report should I click on to view accounts in collections?

text: To view accounts in collections, you can run the "Accounts in Collections" report. This report lists accounts sent to both the collection agency and state debt collections. You can also export the information to Excel by clicking the print icon and selecting Excel.

text.text: What information do I need to enter before clicking "View report" on the Accounts in Collections report?

text: To view the Accounts in Collections report, you need to enter the start and end date. You can then click "View report".

text.text: How do I specify the start and end date for the Accounts in Collections report?

text: To specify the start and end date for the Accounts in Collections report, you can click the print icon and select Excel. You can then export the information to Excel by clicking the print icon and selecting Excel.

text.text: Where can I find the Accounts in Collections report on the Reports page?

text: The Accounts in Collections report is not available on the Reports page. You can run the Accounts in Collections report by clicking the print icon and selecting Excel. You can then export the information to Excel.

text.text: What does the Accounts in Collections report display once I click "View report"?

text: The Accounts in Collections report displays the following information: Account and claim number, HCPCS code, quantity, and charge amount, Accounting period, Patient name. You can export the report to a .csv file to view and manage the data.

text.text: Can I customize the date range for the Accounts in Collections report?

text: To customize the date range for the Accounts in Collections report, you can select a date range and use the suspension type or suspension reason filters.

text.text: What is the purpose of viewing the Accounts in Collections report?

text: The Accounts in Collections report lists all accounts currently in collections, including claim numbers, the amount written-off or suspended, the outstanding debt, and the balance. You can use this report monthly to view how much is outstanding, how much was collected, and to reconcile your books with the collections agency or state debt program.

text.text: How does accessing the Accounts in Collections report help manage collections efficiently?

text: You can also use the Send to Collections report to list accounts sent to collections or state debt collections. This report provides detailed information required by collections or state debt collections.
